citeinfo.title: Photoelectric erosion pin (PEEP) data from Cumberland Island National Seashore (CUIS), May 2012 - May 2013
Spatial and Temporal Assessment of Back-Barrier Erosion on Cumberland Island National Seashore, Georgia, 2011–2013

descript.abstract: This dataset contains daily estimates of erosion for select time windows at four sites along the back barrier margin of Cumberland Island National Seashore (CUIS). The four locations selected for instrumentation are referenced by the name of the general area where they were located and are as follows: Brickhill Bluff (bb), Dungeness Wharf (dw), Plum Orchard (po), and Racoon Key (rk). Additionally, this dataset provides offsets that were used to correct the photo-electric erosion pin (PEEP) erosion values to those measured in the field. Using the offsets and magnitude of erosion between site visits, a running cumulative sum of erosion is also provided.
descript.purpose: These data were collected to evaluate the spatial and temporal behavior of erosion at select locations along the back barrier of CUIS. The high temporal resolution of of the PEEPs was expect to provide greater insight into erosional processes and allow an assessment of meteorological/hydrological conditions to drive erosion in this environment.

idinfo.datacred: funding provided by National Park Service Cumberland Island National Seashore

attracc.attraccr: No formal attribute accuracy tests were conducted

dataqual.logic: No formal logical accuracy tests were conducted
dataqual.complete: Data set is considered complete for the information presented, as described in the abstract. Users are advised to read the rest of the metadata record carefully for additional details.

horizpa.horizpar: No formal positional accuracy tests were conducted

vertacc.vertaccr: No formal positional accuracy tests were conducted

procstep.procdesc: Data were processed on several occasions using the same procedures which are briefly described below. Field measurements of erosion magnitude were made and used to correct the continuous record obtained by the PEEPs. Due to uneven lighting throughout the day an "ideal window" was selected for each site (not necessarliy the same) which had the most uniform lighting and provided stable peep values. The median value within each window was used to represent the the daily erosion value. Further documentation of selected time windows and calibration information is available in the complete report which is cited above.

enttyp.enttypd: Magnitude of erosion at 4 sites on CUIS. Each site has two PEEPs identified as p1 and p2

attr.attrdef: Site identifier to which the data belong

attrdomv.udom: two letter representation of the site id

attr.attrdef: calendar date that measurement(s) was collected
median erosion value in millimeters for peep 1

attrdomv.udom: median erosion estimate in millimeters for the select time window discussed in text of full publication referenced above

attr.attrdef: median erosion value in millimeters for peep 2

attrdomv.udom: daily median erosion estimate in millimeters for the select time window discussed in text of full publication referenced above

attr.attrdef: manual measurement of erosion made during site visits used to correct the continuous PEEP record

attrdomv.udom: field measured erosion magnitude in millimeters + total erosion from previous deployment to be added to to the median PEEP value to get cumulative erosion magnitude over the study at PEEP 1

attr.attrdef: manual measurement of erosion made during site visits used to correct the continuous PEEP record

attrdomv.udom: field measured erosion magnitude in millimeters + total erosion from previous deployment to be added to to the median PEEP value to get cumulative erosion magnitude over the study at PEEP 2

attr.attrdef: median erosion magnitude for PEEP 1 + p1_offset

attrdomv.udom: median erosion magnitude for PEEP 1 + p1_offset

attr.attrdef: median erosion magnitude for PEEP 2 + p2_offset

attrdomv.udom: median erosion magnitude for PEEP 2 + p2_offset
